item.title: Japan's ruling party heads to run-off in election to decide country's next prime minister
item.description: Japan's ruling party will elect the successor to outgoing Prime Minister Fumio Kishida on Friday in a race likely to decide the next leader of the nation.

item.title: Trump set to meet Zelenskyy amid rising tensions over US backing Ukraine
item.description: Donald Trump is set to meet Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Friday morning, expressing confidence in brokering a peace deal with Russia. He criticized the unequal financial support from the US and EU for Ukraine. Meanwhile, Zelenskyy presented his victory plan to President Biden, who reaffirmed continued US support for Ukraine.

item.title: Australia news live: Keating says Labor ‘flogging a dead seahorse’ over Aukus deal; more than half of surging mpox cases in NSW
item.description:
Follow today’s news headlines live

  • Get our breaking news email, free app or daily news podcast

Dutton says PM ‘desperately hoping’ interest rates will fall

Opposition leader Peter Dutton believes Western Australia will play a crucial role in the election. He told the West Australian:

My judgment is that we’re waiting for the results to come in from WA before we know the outcome of the election this time around.

It depends on whether the prime minister’s waiting to see if interest rates come down.

He’d be desperately hoping that they come down in February of next year and he can go from there.

We live in the territory. This is our home. We are fighting to protect our water from the dangers of fracking.

Continue reading...

item.title: Labour urged to scrap UK road schemes such as £9bn Lower Thames Crossing
item.description:
Suggestion would allow government to divert money earmarked for new roads to rail and other public transport

Campaign groups have urged the government to cancel major road building schemes including the Lower Thames Crossing, amid growing speculation that ministers could divert money earmarked for new roads into rail and other public transport.

The transport secretary, Louise Haigh, is due to decide in a week whether to sign off a development consent order [DCO] for the £9bn road crossing linking Essex and Kent.

Continue reading...

item.title: Former 'Apprentice' contestant sells 7.5M shares of Trump Media
A new mystery firm enters Trump's orbit, rekindling criticism of his presidential campaign spending
